results.title: That special look
results.brief_description: A father’s special look, his wise and knowing words, his love for his family. This is a dedication from a daughter to her dad.

results.title: That our children will not die
results.brief_description: Nigeria has the highest death rate in the world. 90% of children die from preventable diseases - fever (malaria) convulsions, diarrhoea, vomiting, bronchopneumonia, measles and malnutrition. In mothers, the majority of deaths are related to pregnancy and child-bearing. Written in a feminist perspective, the film explores the subject of male dominance in the home and the re-education of both men and women in informed decision-making to help save children’s lives. The film also shows the primary health care services available in various parts of Nigeria which use specially trained community health workers in an expanded role. Discusses what needs to be the focus for any health-planning. Narrated by Professor O. Ransome-Kuti.

results.title: That Obscure object of desire = Cet obscur objet du desir
results.creator_credit: Luis Bunuel, Serge Silberman and Greenwich Film Production
results.brief_description: Mathieu (Fernando Rey) is a self-satisfied Spanish businessman whose ordered, elegant life begins to fall apart when he becomes obsessed with the virginal Conchita, who professes love for him, but refuses to have sex with him. Based on a novel by Pierre Louys, “La Femme et le Pantin”, Bunuel’s film version is a comic exploration of the libidinous energies that undermine the precarious safety and order of the bourgeoisie. Though an assured and elegant film, Bunuel utilises surrealist touches, such as having two actresses play the same lead role (Carole Bouquet and Angela Molina) to unsettle and provoke the viewer.

results.title: That mouse
results.creator_credit: Michael Rubbo, Nicholas Balla and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A white mouse cavorts about the forest, mostly on the back of a bumbling black bear, creating such a stir that other forest creatures (a deer, a tortoise, a hawk and a hound) have to put a stop to it. Children will enjoy the way the animals speak with human voices and act out their parts.

results.title: That midnight kiss
results.creator_credit: Norman Taurog, Joe Pasternak and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: An opera singer (Kathryn Grayson) would like to have a tenor who looks the part of the tenor role. When Lanza, a singing truck driver is discovered, she gets her wish - and a happy ending isn’t far away. Cast also includes Jose Iturbi, Ethel Barrymore, Keenan Wynn, J. Carrol Naish, Thomas Gomez.

results.title: That Hamilton woman
results.creator_credit: Alexander Korda and Alexander Korda Films
results.brief_description: That Hamilton woman opens in France, where a destitute and alcoholic woman is arrested for stealing. The woman in question is Lady Emma Hamilton (Vivien Leigh), a once famed beauty. In jail, Emma tells her story to a cellmate, casting back to a time when she was young and lovely. An English woman born to a low class, with a past riddled with infamy, Emma had managed to rise above her station. In Naples Emma is a guest of Sir William Hamilton, a British ambassador, who offers her a financially secure but loveless marriage, to which she agrees. Emma is received at court and revels in the social status of being Lady Hamilton. One day her world is upended with the arrival of Lord Nelson (Laurence Olivier), a British naval hero. Over the course of several years, Emma and Nelson are shown to have a growing affection for one another which blossoms into love. Both are in loveless marriages but divorce is impossible and society views their union with scorn. Leigh excels as Hamilton, a brave woman, beaten by societal mores of the day. The film caused a scandal in America for its depiction of adultery, and dialogue was added to portray the lovers as suffering for their indiscretions.

results.title: That eye, the sky [DVD]
results.creator_credit: John Ruane, Grainne Marmion, Peter Beilby, Working Title Films and Entertainment Media
results.brief_description: When twelve-year-old Ort Flack’s father Sam is plunged into a coma after a truck accident, his family is fractured. As Ort’s mother bravely tries to hold her family together, a mysterious stranger appears and changes their lives - giving Ort courage, comfort and faith. This acclaimed adaptation of the novel by Tim Winton is about the healing power of love, about fantasy and faith, about a boy’s visions of the world beyond and about the blurry distinctions between the natural and the supernatural. Nominated for 9 AFI Awards and starring Peter Coyote, Lisa Harrow and Jamie Croft. Co-starring Amanda Douge, Mark Fairall and Alethea McGrath. Directed by John Ruane (Death in Brunswick), with music by David Bridie.

results.title: That dreaded phone call
results.creator_credit: Ruth Burleigh, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Ruth Burleigh reflects on the day she’ll have to make that dreaded call and put her beloved horse Boris ‘out to pasture’. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with Arts Victoria and the Community Support Fund.
